info.title: Smartdor MVP API
info.summary: Documentation for the Smartdor MVP REST API.

get.description: List the in-progress tasks (i.e. tasks with progress `<100`), and any tasks completed in the last week.

parameters.name: sensorId
parameters.description: The internal ID of the sensor to fetch a list of task for.

parameters.name: sensorId
parameters.description: The internal ID of the sensor to fetch a list of task for.

post.description: This is mainly used for development/testing, and given a downlink task input, it returns the formatted payload that would be sent to TTN if this was the downlink API.

get.description: Fetch a specific task for a sensor.

parameters.name: sensorId
parameters.description: The internal ID of the sensor to fetch a task for.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: The internal ID of the task to fetch,

parameters.name: searchQuery
parameters.description: Search for doors matching this query.

parameters.name: floor
parameters.description: Filter to doors with this floor ID.

get.description: Get a single sensor by its internal ID.
An endpoint that returns all notifications (scoped to an organisation if not an admin), with optional filters to scope down to different resources in the hierarchy (i.e. by site, floor, and door).
Fetch a list of all floors, with optional filters to scope to parent resources.
Fetch a list of all sites for an organisation.
Fetch a list of all organizations.

floors.description: Total number of floors within this site.

doors.description: Total number of doors within this site.

sensors.description: Total number of sensors within this site.

get.description: Fetch a single site by its ID.

sensors.description: Total number of sensors within this floor.

doors.description: Total number of doors within this floor.

get.description: Fetch a single floor by its ID.
Get a tenant by their ID

post.summary: Assign a door to a tenant

delete.summary: Unassign a door from a tenant

get.summary: Get all doors assigned to a tenant

id.description: Unique internal ID for this task.

sensorId.description: The internal ID of the related sensor for this task.

deviceId.description: The TTN device ID (or internal `sensorCode`) for the related sensor.

status.description: Current status of this task - reflects the TTN Gateway status.

stage.description: The user-friendly name for the tasks current stage.

stageDescription.description: A user-friendly description for the current task stage - can be shown in the UI.
stageDescription.example: The downlink command has been queued, ready to be sent to the device.

progress.description:
The current progress of this task, as a percentage (0-100%). 
Will be `100` when the task has completed or failed, and anything below `100` indicates the task is in progress.

errorMessage.description: If this task failed, this field may contain a user-facing reason why the task failed, and any next steps.

payload.description: The formatted payload that was sent to TTN (likely a base64 string).

input.description: A JSON field that contains the original user-specified input data for this task.

SensorConfigureInput.title: Sensor Configure Input
SensorConfigureInput.description: The different inputs a user can send to configure a sensor (via the downlink API).

name.description: The user's first and last names concatenated.

roleId.description: The internal ID of the user's role - shouldn't be used anymore.

role.description: The user's role, as an enum member.

roleName.description: The 'nice' role name, for showing in the UI.

organizationId.description: The user's organization ID. This may be `null` for admin users.

disabled.description: Whether this user is disabled, and therefore blocked from logging in or accessing resources.

receiveEmailNotifications.description: Whether this user can receive email notifications - set at admin/org admin level.

publicUrl.description:
The URL to our proxy middleware - rather than just returning a signed URL (as it is async with GCS, and Sequlize doesn't support that), we return a URL to our API, with the image path as a query param. The API then async generates a computed URL, and redirects the browser to that URL.

Kinda silly, so something to fix at somepoint.

value.description: Set how often the sensor transmits a report, in seconds.
Set how often a measurement is taken, in seconds.

key.description: Door Open Timeout for Alert message (in minutes).

value.description: Set the timeout threshold for door open alerts, in minutes.

key.description: Door Slam and Tamper detection configuration parameters.

tamperEnabled.description: Set whether the tamper detection is enabled.

slamXEnabled.description: Set whether the X-axis slam detection is enabled.

slamYEnabled.description: Set whether the Y-axis slam detection is enabled.

slamZEnabled.description: Set whether the Z-axis slam detection is enabled.

xAxisThreshold.description: Set the X-axis threshold for detection.

yzAxisThreshold.description: Set the YZ-axis threshold for detection.

dataRateHz.description: The data rate (in `Hz`) to use. Must be one of the predefined values.

gRange.description: The G range (in `g`) to use. Must be one of the predefined values.

PaginationParams.title: Pagination Parameters
PaginationParams.description: Generic pagination parameters shape, used across most API endpoints.

sortBy.description: Differs between endpoints - see specific endpoint's reference for more information.

FilterParams.title: Filter Parameters
FilterParams.description: Filter parameters for different endpoints, including notifications and events.

sensorCode.description: The unique sensor (device) code, from TTN.

deviceCode.description: The sensor code, but without the `eui-` prefix.

qrCode.description: The QR code ID for this sensor.

reportingFrequency.description: How often the sensor transmits data, in seconds.

lastReading.description: The timestamp of the last event that came in from this sensor.

nextExpectedReading.description: Computed value for the next expected update time.

location.description: Where this sensor is located on the door - usually `top` or `side`.

statuses.description: An array of sensor statuses, formatted to have consistent names and values.

name.description: The formatted status name - likely converted from the database column name.

value.description: The status value - will likely be a boolean, or a string.

offsets.description: A formatted array of sensor offsets.

batteryStatus.description: Indicates a battery issue with this sensor.

floorId.description: If this door has been assigned to a floor, then this is the floor's ID.

assigneeId.description: If this door has been assigned to an installer, then this is the user's ID.

customerRef.description: Customer defined reference for this door.

description.description:
Terribly named field - but this is the internal door reference.
Starts with `HF`, and is `7` numbers.

name.description: A name field computed from the customer ref + description fields.

status.description: The doors current overall status - computed from the current statuses (although currently set by the sensor update function).

direction.description: The door opening direction - either CW (clockwise) or CCW (counter-clockwise).

systemStatus.description: Indicates a system error - i.e. a low or critical battery level.

orientationStatus.description: Indicates if the door has been taken off its hinges.

gapsStatus.description: Indicates the current gaps status - may be alert or warning.

timeoutStatus.description: Indicates if the door currently has a open timeout alert.

utilisation.description: Utilisation statistics for this door (open counts).

day.description: The week **start** date for this count.

count.description: The total open count for this week.

lifetime.description: The lifetime open count for this door, split into weeks.

items.description: The lifetime open count for this door, split into weeks.

week.description: The week (start date) this count is for.

count.description: The total open count for this weeks period - NOT the rolling open count.

total.description: The total(rolling) open count for this door.

name.description: The floor name, computed from the customer defined description, or the floor number.

status.description: The current aggregated status for this floor, computed from all doors within this floor.

FormattedObject.title: Formatted Object
FormattedObject.description: A generic shape we frequently format arrays of objects into, to have a normalized schema.

key.description: The unique (likely `camelCase`) key for this value.

point.description: The basic measurement point, without any prefix/suffix like 'measurement' or 'gap'.

name.description: The friendly name for this value - can be displayed in the UI.

formatted.description: The formatted value - may include units.

message.description: The readable message content for this notification.

doorId.description: The internal ID for the door this notification was created for.

type.description: The type of notification this is.

typeLower.description: A formatted/normalized version of the `type` field.

count.description: Total number of results for this query.

Authorization.description: Authenticated by a bearer token, from the login endpoint.

NotFound.description: The shape of a generic `404` response - should be JSON, with an object containing a `message` field that returns a user-friendly error message that can be displayed in the app.

message.description: A message for this response - may or may not be specific to the current resource, but is always user-friendly, so can be shown in the app.

ValidationError.description: Zod is used for input validation, so this is the shape of the returned response if there are validation errors.

DownlinkTaskCreate.description: The different inputs a user can send to configure a sensor (via the downlink API).
